p: Dengue fever is endemic in Pakistan and spreads with an increase in temperature. As the temperature rises, the number of cases reported increase. Over-population as well as inadequate facilities in homes and towns, along with poor management of sewerage and water management, are the major reasons for the spread of dengue fever. Stagnant water in cities and towns provide breeding habitat for vector growth and its multiplication. Other reasons include travel and spread of viral infection from one region to another.
